comments.body: this does not feel great too me. wondering if there is a better way of doing this.
Looks like the best we can do ATM.

Ideally, this should be:
```
errs = append(errs, errors.Wrapf(err, "Failed to get the version of package %q", packageName))
```

hahahahaha. So originally I did what you are saying here. BUT the error returned from `manager.getPackageVersion()` effectively says the same exact thing. I caught this because we have a test and the test failed because the error returned changed what it said. and it was mostly redundant. I can change it back to this way and update the test, it just did not seem necessary yesterday.
Ok, let's leave it like that then.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +127,131 @@		version, err := manager.getPackageVersion(packageName)
		if err != nil {
			errs = append(errs, err)
			validator.reporter.Report(nameWithVerRange, "not installed", bad)
			continue

comments.body:
Again:
```
errs = append(errs, errors.Wrapf(err, "Failed to convert %q to semantic version", version))
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +144,148 @@		sv, err := semver.Make(toSemVer(version))
		if err != nil {
			errs = append(errs, err)
			validator.reporter.Report(nameWithVerRange, "internal error", bad)
			continue
